meta.name: description

div.div:
MDE School Closure
* CHILD CARE SUPPORT FOR FAMILIES OF EMERGENCY RESPONSE WORKERS LINK*
This update contains information that you will need as an ISD 316 community member.
Governor Walz directed all K-12 public and charter schools to close starting Monday, March 30th for a period ending on Thursday April 30th. Students will be participating in Distance Learning during this time. The plan is for students to return to school on Tuesday May 5th, 2020, unless Governor Walz deems it necessary to continue distance learning beyond May 5th.

Greenway Public Schools offer each student and every family the personal attention required to ensure children acquire the foundational skills necessary for a meaningful life and career and can access a vast array of educational and extra-curricular activitiesthat contribute to a successful education.

Greenway Public Schools are the heart of a community that includes more than 1,000 students, pre-kindergarten through grade 12, from LaPrairie, Coleraine, Bovey, Taconite, Marble, Calumet, Pengilly, Trout Lake Township, Iron Range Township, Greenway Township, Lawrence Lake Township and Nashwauk Township.

div.br:
Kindergarten through 12th grade students attend Vandyke Elementary and Greenway High School on a single campus in Coleraine. Early childhood and pre-kindergarten children are served at the Marble School.
The Mission of Greenway Public Schools is to provide a safe, educational environment which embraces diversity and equips learners with lifelong skills enabling them to succeed, to think independently, and to act respectfully when meeting the challenges of a changing society. This mission will be accomplished by students families, staff, school board and the community working together to maintain high standards and quality programs.
